_metadata.description: Per-dimension drift priors (delta_mu, sigma) for emergent time calibration
_metadata.source: Empirical CES 2019-2021 cross-wave analysis + literature estimates
notes: delta_mu: Mean change in dimension value over 2-year election cycle (scaled to 0-1)
Empirical values from CES 2019/2021 parquet files where available
Other dimensions: Literature-based pending additional CES variables
references: Fournier, P. (2006). The impact of campaigns on discrepancies, errors, and biases in voting behavior. In H.E. Brady & R. Johnston (Eds.), Capturing Campaign Effects.
Gidengil, E. et al. (2012). Dominance and Decline: Making Sense of Recent Canadian Elections.
Converse, P.E. (1964). The Nature of Belief Systems in Mass Publics.
Green, D., Palmquist, B., & Schickler, E. (2002). Partisan Hearts and Minds.

engagement.notes: Moderate stability; varies with life events, campaigns

ideology.notes: EMPIRICAL: CES ideology 2019→2021 (delta=0.002, avg_std=0.24) - highly stable

partisanship.notes: Highly stable; 'unmoved mover' in Canadian politics

sociogeographic.notes: Very stable; changes mainly with migration

tie_to_place.notes: Stable unless major life transition (move, job change)

group_modifiers._description: Multiplicative adjustments to base delta_mu/sigma by group characteristics

aggregate_priors._description: Pre-computed aggregate delta_mu/sigma for quick lookup (weighted mean of dimensions)
aggregate_priors.notes: Equal-weighted mean across 7 dimensions; use dimension-specific for tau calibration
